definition: warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]

sentences.english: The Sun Yat-Sen Mausoleum is like a huge green leaf that warms and comforts the heart of every people in Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 中山陵象一片巨大的绿叶，温润着每个南京人的心灵。
它是亚热带温润季风气候。

sentences.english: The development of civilization for this blessed land, a great wall and a kingdom of poetry, has become prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 文明的脚步，就在这绵延十里的诗国长城，温润开来。

sentences.english: Warm color, texture is soft, smooth and even sweet printed button work luxuriant .
sentences.chinese: 质地温润，色泽匀净，光润甜柔，印钮作工华丽。

sentences.english: He is handsome and graceful, and particularily a modest fellow, gentle as a jade.
sentences.chinese: 他英俊优雅，更难得的是谦谦君子，温润如玉。

sentences.english: A language with me a word clearly in whispers.
sentences.chinese: 同我一字一语的温润细语。

sentences.english: I like your lips, warm and soft.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你的唇，温润柔软。

sentences.english: She smiled, as she tasted its rich aroma.
sentences.chinese: 尝到她温润馨香的味道她笑了。

sentences.english: His warm moist tongue would caress the hand of his master.
sentences.chinese: 它会用温润的舌头舔舐主人的手。

sentences.english: I love all the chocolate chips and its moist texture.
sentences.chinese: 我喜爱所有巧克力豆的芬芳，以及那种温润的纹理。

definition: pure and limpid/(of a person) quick-witted
(usually of sth intangible) to seep into/to permeate
